body_text.text: Due to the millions of individuals who suffer from major depression today, and the delayed efficacy of the existing therapeutic agents, there exists an interest in finding a safer compound with robust and rapid antidepressant effects (Krystal et al., 2013;Caddy et al., 2014).
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: The most famous rapid antidepressant, Ketamine, a non-competitive N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA) receptor antagonist, was found to rely on increasing α-amino-3-hydroxy-5-methyl-4-isoxazole propionic acid (AMPA) signaling to exert its antidepressant efficacy (Maeng et al., 2008).
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: A previous study has shown that a traditional Chinese medicine, Cordyceps Militaris powder, demonstrated an antidepressant effect in the tail suspension test (TST;Nishizawa et al., 2007).
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Moreover, 3'-deoxyadenosine (3'-dA, Cordycepin), one of the major bioactive metabolites in the Cordyceps Militaris (Tuli et al., 2013), exerted a beneficial effect in a 6-week chronic unpredictable mild stress (CUMS) mouse model via the forced swim test (FST; Tianzhu et al., 2014).
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: 3'-dA possesses a wide range of beneficial effects of therapeutic potential, including anti-insomnia, antiinflammatory, anti-cancer, anti-viral, and anti-fungal activities (Hu et al., 2013;Tuli et al., 2013).
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: However, whether or not 3'-dA has a fast-acting antidepressant effect remains unknown.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Glutamate mediates the vast majority of excitatory transmissions and about 80% of neurons form 85% of the synapses, which are spiny and excitatory in the central nervous system (CNS; Douglas and Martin, 2007;Sanacora et al., 2012).
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: A growing body of evidence suggests that the glutamatergic system might be very important in the pathophysiology and treatment of depression (Krystal et al., 2002;Sanacora et al., 2012;Musazzi et al., 2013;Pilc et al., 2013).
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: The AMPA receptor channel is a tetramer assembled from the four subunits, including GluR1, GluR2, GluR3, and GluR4.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Clinical evidence has shown that the expression of AMPA receptors, particularly GluR1, is decreased in the brains of patients with depression (Beneyto et al., 2007;Duric et al., 2013).
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Additionally, the trafficking of AMPA receptor subunit GluR1 and synaptic plasticity are regulated by the phosphorylation of specific subunits (Malinow and Malenka, 2002;Esteban et al., 2003).
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Phosphorylation of GluR1 at serine 845 (S845) was increased following antidepressant treatment with flouxetine or tianeptine in mice (Svenningsson et al., 2002(Svenningsson et al., , 2007, suggesting that phosphorylation of GluR1 might be associated with the potentiation of AMPA receptor currents (Wang et al., 2005).
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Previous studies have shown that phosphorylation of GluR1 at S845 and GluR1 synaptic localization might be common mechanisms for the agents with antidepressant efficacy, such as imipramine, lamotrigine, and riluzol (Du et al., 2007;Gould et al., 2008).
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: However, whether 3'-dA regulates AMPA synaptic plasticity is still unknown.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Based on these premises, we designed a series of behavioral and biochemical experiments to investigate the antidepressant effects of 3'-dA in animal models of depression.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: We studied the rapid and chronic effects of various concentrations of 3'-dA via behavioral tests, including the TST, FST, and open field test (OFT).
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: The phosphorylation of GluR1 S845 and synaptic localization of GluR1 and GluR2 were determined in the prefrontal cortex (PFC) and hippocampus (HIP) after 45-min and 5-day treatments.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: In addition, the role of the enhanced AMPA function in the rapid antidepressant effect was addressed by pretreatment with AMPA receptor-specific antagonist GYKI 52466 followed by TST.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: All animal treatments, procedures, and care were approved by the medical ethics committee of the School of Medicine, Yunnan University, and followed the Guide for the Care and Use of Laboratory Animals (ISBN 0-309-05377-3).
body_text.section: Animal Behavioral Studies

body_text.text: Male CD-1 mice (6 weeks; starting weight, 23-28 g; Vital River) were group housed (n = 4/cage) in an animal room with a constant temperature (21 ± 3°C) and maintained on a 12-hour light/dark cycle (lights on/off at 09:00 and 21:00 hours), with constant humidity (55 ± 10%) and free access to water and food.
body_text.section: Animal Behavioral Studies

body_text.text: After a 1-week acclimatization period, the mice were treated with drugs or vehicle in a volume of 10 μl/g by intraperitonial (i.p.) injection and tested between 10:00 and 14:00 hours.
body_text.section: Animal Behavioral Studies

body_text.text: To examine the rapid (45-min treatment) and chronic (5-day treatment) antidepressant effects of 3'-dA (Sigma), mice were randomly assigned to four treatment groups: saline (0.9% sterile sodium chloride solution), low dose of 3'-dA (5 mg/kg, dissolved in saline), high dose of 3'-dA (12.5 mg/kg, in saline), and imipramine (15 mg/kg, in saline; Sigma).
body_text.section: Animal Behavioral Studies

body_text.text: Animal behavioral tests were performed 45 minutes after drug or vehicle administration, TST was performed on the first day, OFT on the third day, and FST on the fifth day.
body_text.section: Animal Behavioral Studies

body_text.text: To confirm the rapid and chronic antidepressant effects of 3'-dA, another two batches of mice were subjected to the FST and TST, respectively, under similar settings.
body_text.section: Animal Behavioral Studies

body_text.text: To examine whether the rapid antidepressant effect of 3'-dA could be blocked by GYKI 52466 (a selective non-competitive AMPA receptor antagonist; TOCRIS Bioscience, R&D), mice were treated with GYKI 52466 (30 mg/kg in 26% DMSO/74% saline), followed by a high dose of 3'-dA treatment.
body_text.section: Animal Behavioral Studies

body_text.text: Since a previous study showed that plasma levels of GYKI 52466 peaked at 15 minutes after i.p. injection and then fell to 21% of the peak value at 60 minutes (De Sarro et al., 1998), we administered GYKI 15 minutes before 3'-dA treatment and performed the TST 45 minutes later.
body_text.section: Animal Behavioral Studies

body_text.text: For each drug treatment, the control mice received the respective vehicle alone.
body_text.section: Animal Behavioral Studies

body_text.text: A 7 cm long and 2 cm wide tape was positioned with approximately 2 mm of tail protruding.
body_text.section: Tail Suspension Test

body_text.text: In a series of pilot experiments using this procedure, we observed that no mice climbed their tails.
body_text.section: Tail Suspension Test

body_text.text: Each mouse was individually suspended by the tail from a bar (30 cm high) and videotaped during a 6-min test session.
body_text.section: Tail Suspension Test

body_text.text: Immobility time was quantified by a naive observer for the last 4 minutes.
body_text.section: Tail Suspension Test

body_text.text: An activity chamber (60 × 60 × 30 cm) with a black floor divided into 16 squares of an equal area (15 × 15 cm) by white lines was used to study 3'-dA-induced hyperactivity.
body_text.section: Open Field Test

body_text.text: After 3 days of i.p. injection of drugs, mice were placed in the center of the chamber and their behavior was recorded for 60 minutes.
body_text.section: Open Field Test

body_text.text: Total distance traveled and the amount of distance traveled in the center area (the 4-square area in the middle of the chamber) were analyzed by Anymaze system (Stoelting).
body_text.section: Open Field Test

body_text.text: Mice were placed in a cylinder (Ф = 20 cm) with water 20 cm in depth (temperature between 23 ± 1°C).
body_text.section: Forced Swim Test

body_text.text: Mice were videotaped during a 6-min test session, which was later analyzed by a naive observer for activity during the final 4 minutes.
body_text.section: Forced Swim Test

body_text.text: Mobility was defined as any movement beyond what was necessary to maintain the head above water.
body_text.section: Forced Swim Test

body_text.text: After the behavioral experiments, all mice were decapitated immediately.
body_text.section: Forced Swim Test

body_text.text: The PFC and HIP were dissected, frozen rapidly in liquid nitrogen, and stored at −80°C until further analysis.
body_text.section: Forced Swim Test

body_text.text: PFC or HIP tissue was lysed with an ice-cold radioimmunoprecipitation assay buffer (20 mM Tris [pH 7.5], 150 mM NaCl, 1% Triton X-100, sodium pyrophosphate, β-glycerophosphate, EDTA, Na 3 VO 4, leupeptin plus a Protease Inhibitor Cocktail Tablet [Roche], and Phosphatase Inhibitor Cocktail Tablet [Roche]) in a tissue grinder (Wheaton).
body_text.section: Western Blot Analysis

body_text.text: Protein concentrations were determined using the BCA protein assay kit (Pierce Biotechnology).
body_text.section: Western Blot Analysis

body_text.text: Equal amounts of proteins were subjected to 7-10% SDS-PAGE gels electrophoresis, then transferred to polyvinylidene difluoride (PVDF) membranes (Pall) and blocked with 1% BSA in TBST (0.1% Tween).
body_text.section: Western Blot Analysis

body_text.text: Antibodies against Phos-GluR1 S845 (Rabbit mAb, 1:1000, Cell Signaling Technology) and GluR1 (Goat pAb, 1:1000, Santa Cruz) in 5% BSA-TBST were applied to the membranes.
body_text.section: Western Blot Analysis

body_text.text: The secondary antibodies were horseradish peroxidase conjugated goat anti-rabbit (1:5000, Affinity Bioscience) or donkey anti-goat antibodies (1:5000, Santa Cruz).
body_text.section: Western Blot Analysis

body_text.text: Antibody for β-actin (Mouse mAb, 0.2 μg/ml, Affinity Bioscience) was applied for loading calibration.
body_text.section: Western Blot Analysis

body_text.text: Immunoreactive bands were visualized using the ECL detection system (Millipore).
body_text.section: Western Blot Analysis

body_text.text: Images were acquired by the FlourChem E image system (FE0511, ProteinSimple) and quantified by the Image-Pro Plus Version 6.0 software (Media Cybernetics).
body_text.section: Western Blot Analysis

body_text.text: Synaptosomal fractions were prepared from PFC or HIP tissue using the differential and discontinuous Ficoll gradient centrifugation method (Pozzo-Miller et al., 1999;Du et al., 2004aDu et al., , 2008.
body_text.section: Synaptosomes Preparation

body_text.text: Tissue was homogenized by tissue grinder and then electronic polytron homogenizer (AutoScience) in cold Syn buffer (300 mM mannitol and 1 mM EDTA, pH 7.4).
body_text.section: Synaptosomes Preparation

body_text.text: The crude homogenates were centrifuged at 5000 × g for 10 minutes and the supernatants were again centrifuged at 15000 × g for 30 minutes.
body_text.section: Synaptosomes Preparation

body_text.text: The resuspended pellets were loaded on Ficoll gradient tubes and centrifuged at 22000 × g for 90 minutes.
body_text.section: Synaptosomes Preparation

body_text.text: The 8/12% and 12/16% interfaces were carefully removed, diluted in Syn buffer in a ratio of 1:4, and centrifuged for 20 minutes at 15000 × g.
body_text.section: Synaptosomes Preparation

body_text.text: Pellets were resuspended and lysed with Lysis buffer.
body_text.section: Synaptosomes Preparation

body_text.text: All samples were constantly maintained at 4°C during all steps.
body_text.section: Synaptosomes Preparation

body_text.text: Western blot was applied to analyze the synaptic expressions of Phos-GluR1 S845, GluR1, and GluR2 (Rabbit mAb, 1:2000, Abcam).
body_text.section: Synaptosomes Preparation

body_text.text: All data were analyzed by one-way ANOVA and post hoc Bonferroni (unequal sample) or Tukey (equal sample) tests and presented as the mean ± standard error via SPSS 17.
body_text.section: Statistical Analysis

body_text.text: A p-value less than 0.05 was considered a significant difference.
body_text.section: Statistical Analysis

body_text.text: Figures were generated by Graphpad Prism Version 5 software.

body_text.text: To investigate whether 3'-dA plays a role in regulating depression-like behavior, we i.p. injected the 7-week-old CD-1 mice with a low (5 mg/kg) or high (12.5 mg/kg) dose of 3'-dA for 45 minutes or 5 days.
body_text.section: 3'-dA Demonstrated a Rapid and Significant Antidepressant Effect

body_text.text: 45 minutes after the treatment, mice were subjected to either the TST or FST.
body_text.section: 3'-dA Demonstrated a Rapid and Significant Antidepressant Effect

body_text.text: The data showed that the immobility times in the 3'-dA-treated groups were significantly lower than in the controls (101.74 ± 6.49 sec) in a dose dependent manner: 54.60 ± 7.73 sec (for 12.5 mg/kg of 3'-dA) and 76.57 ± 6.49 sec (for 5 mg/kg of 3'-dA) in the TST ( Figure 1A).
body_text.section: 3'-dA Demonstrated a Rapid and Significant Antidepressant Effect

body_text.text: It is noteworthy that the high dose of 3'-dA (12.5 mg/kg) reduced the immobility time of TST to a much larger extent than that of the comparable traditional antidepressant imipramine (15 mg/kg; Figure 1A).
body_text.section: 3'-dA Demonstrated a Rapid and Significant Antidepressant Effect

body_text.text: To confirm the data in the TST, the FST was performed under similar settings.
body_text.section: 3'-dA Demonstrated a Rapid and Significant Antidepressant Effect

body_text.text: After 45 minutes of treatment with 3'-dA, the high dose group also demonstrated a stronger antidepressant effect, as low as 48.23 ± 10.11 sec, compared with the control (92.69 ± 9.24 sec) and the imipramine group (79.92 ± 9.92 sec; Figure 1B).
body_text.section: 3'-dA Demonstrated a Rapid and Significant Antidepressant Effect

body_text.text: To further study this antidepressant effect for long-term treatment, we treated the mice with a low (5 mg/kg) or high (12.5 mg/kg) dose of 3'-dA for 5 days, then performed the TST and FST.

body_text.text: To further determine whether 3'-dA causes locomotor hyperactivity, one of the core features of mania-like symptoms, we performed the OFT after 3 days of treatment with a low or high dose of 3'-dA.
body_text.section: Unlike the Psycho-Stimulants, 3'-dA Did Not Show Locomotor Hyperactivity in the OFT

body_text.text: The total distance traveled showed no significant difference in 3'-dA-treated groups compared with controls, suggesting that 3'-dA does not cause hyperactivity in mice (Figure 2A).
body_text.section: Unlike the Psycho-Stimulants, 3'-dA Did Not Show Locomotor Hyperactivity in the OFT

body_text.text: This is different from the psycho-stimulant amphetamine, which significantly increased the total distance travelled in rats during the OFT (Labonte et al., 2012).
body_text.section: Unlike the Psycho-Stimulants, 3'-dA Did Not Show Locomotor Hyperactivity in the OFT

body_text.text: 3'-dA showed a trend to increase the distance travelled in the center area, but it was not statistically significant ( Figure 2B).

body_text.text: The weights of mice after 5 days of treatment did not show a significant difference ( Figure 2C).

body_text.text: Previous studies from our group showed that phosphorylation of AMPA GluR1 S845 presented a common mechanism for the treatment of depression (Du et al., 2007).
body_text.section: After 45 Min of Treatment, High Concentration of 3'-dA Enhanced AMPA GluR1 S845 Phosphorylation in the PFC and HIP

body_text.text: In this context, we further addressed whether Phos-GluR1 S845 levels were changed after treatment with 3'-dA.
body_text.section: After 45 Min of Treatment, High Concentration of 3'-dA Enhanced AMPA GluR1 S845 Phosphorylation in the PFC and HIP

body_text.text: We found that after 45 minutes of i.p. injection, the phosphorylation of GluR1 S845 was rapidly and significantly increased in both the PFC and HIP from the high-dose 3'-dA-treated group ( Figure 3A).
body_text.section: After 45 Min of Treatment, High Concentration of 3'-dA Enhanced AMPA GluR1 S845 Phosphorylation in the PFC and HIP

body_text.text: In contrast, the phosphorylation of GluR1 S845 in the imipramine-treated group remained unchanged after 45 minutes of treatment, which is consistent with the fact that the antidepressant effects of imipramine were not significant after 45 minutes of treatment ( Figures 1A and B and 3A).
body_text.section: After 45 Min of Treatment, High Concentration of 3'-dA Enhanced AMPA GluR1 S845 Phosphorylation in the PFC and HIP

body_text.text: The levels of total GluR1 proteins in these brain regions remained unchanged ( Figure 3B).
body_text.section: After 45 Min of Treatment, High Concentration of 3'-dA Enhanced AMPA GluR1 S845 Phosphorylation in the PFC and HIP

body_text.text: To determine the long-term effects of 3'-dA, we treated the mice with 3'-dA for 5 days, and found that the phosphorylation of GluR1 S845 was significantly increased in both the low (175.44 ± 14.32%; 169.86 ± 11.83%) and high (174.75 ± 13.00%; 158.06 ± 11.62%) dose groups in the PFC and HIP, respectively ( Figure 3C).
body_text.section: After 5 Days of Treatment, 3'-dA and Imipramine Enhanced AMPA GluR1 S845 Phosphorylation in Both the PFC and HIP

body_text.text: The imipramine-treated group also demonstrated a significant increase in Phos-GluR1 S845 levels in both the PFC (163.02 ± 12.08%) and HIP (148.52 ± 12.16%) after 5 days of treatment ( Figure 3C), which is consistent with a previous publication (Du et al., 2007).
body_text.section: After 5 Days of Treatment, 3'-dA and Imipramine Enhanced AMPA GluR1 S845 Phosphorylation in Both the PFC and HIP

body_text.text: The total GluR1 levels in the PFC and HIP remained unchanged ( Figure 3D).
body_text.section: After 5 Days of Treatment, 3'-dA and Imipramine Enhanced AMPA GluR1 S845 Phosphorylation in Both the PFC and HIP

body_text.text: To further determine whether GluR1 localization at the synapses in the PFC or HIP was increased, we isolated the synaptosomal fractions from the PFC and HIP tissue.
body_text.section: After 45 Min of Treatment, 3'-dA Significantly Up-Regulated AMPA GluR1 S845 Phosphorylation and GluR1 Levels at the Synapses in the PFC

body_text.text: Western blot analysis of Phos-GluR1 S845, GluR1, and GluR2 were performed with the synaptic fractions.
body_text.section: After 45 Min of Treatment, 3'-dA Significantly Up-Regulated AMPA GluR1 S845 Phosphorylation and GluR1 Levels at the Synapses in the PFC

body_text.text: Here, we found that levels of GluR1 and GluR2 were significantly enriched at the synapses, compared with the total protein ( Figure 4A).
body_text.section: After 45 Min of Treatment, 3'-dA Significantly Up-Regulated AMPA GluR1 S845 Phosphorylation and GluR1 Levels at the Synapses in the PFC

body_text.text: After 45 minutes of treatment with the high dose of 3'-dA (12.5 mg/kg), Phos-GluR1 S845 and GluR1 levels, but not GluR2 levels, were significantly increased in the synaptosomal fractions in the PFC ( Figures 4B and C and 5A).
body_text.section: After 45 Min of Treatment, 3'-dA Significantly Up-Regulated AMPA GluR1 S845 Phosphorylation and GluR1 Levels at the Synapses in the PFC

body_text.text: It is noteworthy that the acute treatment of the traditional antidepressant imipramine did not lead to a significant increase in GluR1 levels at the synapses ( Figure 4C), which is consistent with the results in the TST and FST after 45 minutes of treatment ( Figure 1A and B).
body_text.section: After 45 Min of Treatment, 3'-dA Significantly Up-Regulated AMPA GluR1 S845 Phosphorylation and GluR1 Levels at the Synapses in the PFC

body_text.text: After 5 days of treatment with drugs, 3'-dA and imipramine enhanced the phosphorylation levels of GluR1 S845 in the PFC and HIP ( Figure 4D).
body_text.section: After 5 Days of Treatment, 3'-dA Significantly Enhanced AMPA Receptor GluR1 S845 Phosphorylation and GluR1, But Not GluR2 Levels at the Synapses

body_text.text: We found that both the low and high doses of 3'-dA induced an increase in GluR1 S845 phosphorylation (low dose: 304.01 ± 24.46% in PFC, 244.82 ± 28.91% in HIP; high dose: 285.14 ± 24.54% in PFC, 245.27 ± 26.39% in HIP).
body_text.section: After 5 Days of Treatment, 3'-dA Significantly Enhanced AMPA Receptor GluR1 S845 Phosphorylation and GluR1, But Not GluR2 Levels at the Synapses

body_text.text: Both the low and high doses of 3'-dA induced an increase in GluR1 levels (low dose: 144.12 ± 10.21% in PFC, 129.02 ± 5.04% in HIP; high dose: 152.37 ± 12.47% in PFC, 147.48 ± 10.98% in HIP), but not GluR2 levels, in the PFC and HIP, suggesting that the regulation of 3'-dA to AMPA was subtype-specific.
body_text.section: After 5 Days of Treatment, 3'-dA Significantly Enhanced AMPA Receptor GluR1 S845 Phosphorylation and GluR1, But Not GluR2 Levels at the Synapses

body_text.text: For the imipramine-treated group, chronic treatment resulted in both GluR1 (157.46 ± 7.69% in PFC) and GluR2 (138.01 ± 9.20% in PFC) increases at the synapses, suggesting the regulation is in a GluR1/2 subtype-specific manner, which is different from the 3'-dA regulation ( Figure 4E and 5B).
body_text.section: After 5 Days of Treatment, 3'-dA Significantly Enhanced AMPA Receptor GluR1 S845 Phosphorylation and GluR1, But Not GluR2 Levels at the Synapses

body_text.text: We hypothesized that the AMPA receptor increase is critical for the rapid antidepressant effects of 3'-dA.
body_text.section: The Rapid Antidepressant Effect of 3'-dA was Blocked by the AMPA Receptor Specific Antagonist GYKI 52466

body_text.text: To determine whether the rapid antidepressant effects of 3'-dA could be blocked by the AMPA receptor-specific antagonist GYKI 52466, we pretreated the mice with 30 mg/kg of GYKI, followed by the i.p. injection of 3'-dA (12.5 mg/kg).
body_text.section: The Rapid Antidepressant Effect of 3'-dA was Blocked by the AMPA Receptor Specific Antagonist GYKI 52466

body_text.text: The mice were subjected to TST 45 minutes after the 3'-dA injection.
body_text.section: The Rapid Antidepressant Effect of 3'-dA was Blocked by the AMPA Receptor Specific Antagonist GYKI 52466

body_text.text: The pretreatment of GYKI 52466 almost completely blocked the decrease of immobility time caused by 3'-dA (control: 130.06 ± 11.67 sec; 3'-dA: 65.69 ± 12.02 sec; GYKI + 3'-dA: 122.91 ± 8.65 sec; Figure 6), suggesting that enhanced AMPA receptor excitability at the synapses might play an important role in the rapid antidepressant effects of 3'-dA.
body_text.section: The Rapid Antidepressant Effect of 3'-dA was Blocked by the AMPA Receptor Specific Antagonist GYKI 52466

body_text.text: This study sought to determine the rapid and robust antidepressant effects of 3'-dA and its possible underlying mechanisms in regulating AMPA receptor signaling.
body_text.section: Discussion

body_text.text: We found that: (1) 3'-dA had rapid and robust antidepressant effects in the TST and FST after 45 min of treatment, and this effect remained after 5 days of treatment; (2) unlike the psycho-stimulants, 3'-dA had no hyperactive effect in the OFT; (3) after 45 min of treatment, only high doses of 3'-dA enhanced Phos-GluR1 S845 in the PFC and HIP, and after 5 days of treatment, 3'-dA, similar to imipramine, enhanced Phos-GluR1 S845 in both the PFC and HIP; (4) after 45 min of treatment, only high doses of 3'-dA enhanced Phos-GluR1 S845 and GluR1, but not GluR2 levels, at the synapses in the PFC, and after 5 days of treatment, 3'-dA enhanced Phos-GluR1 S845 and GluR1, but not GluR2 levels, at the synapse in both the PFC and HIP; and (5) AMPA receptor-specific antagonist GYKI 52466 was able to block the rapid and robust antidepressant effects of 3'-dA, suggesting enhanced AMPA synaptic transmission is essential for the rapid antidepressant effects.
